creator: christophe.jaillet@wanadoo.fr
text:
In http://httpd.apache.org/bug_report.html we have shortcuts to bugzilla :

* All bugs fixed in the last 60 days
--> http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/buglist.cgi?resolution=FIXED&changedin=60&product=Apache+httpd-2

* All bugs changed in the last 10 days
--> http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/buglist.cgi?changedin=10&product=Apache+httpd-2


I would expect some results from the latter to be included in the former. It is not the case.


As of today the results are :

ID▲ 	Product 	Comp 	Assignee▲ 	Status▲ 	Resolution 	Summary 	Changed
53334 	Apache h 	Document 	docs@httpd.apache.org 	RESO 	FIXE 	non * name-based vhosts sometimes short-circut ServerName/ServerAlias 	2012-06-03 

vs

ID▲ 	Product 	Comp 	Assignee▲ 	Status▲ 	Resolution 	Summary 	Changed
49809 	Apache h 	Core 	bugs@httpd.apache.org 	RESO 	WONT 	DirectoryMatch never matches EOL/$, applies to subdirectories 	2012-07-23
52648 	Apache h 	All 	bugs@httpd.apache.org 	RESO 	FIXE 	Code clean up (remove useless memory allocation) 	2012-07-23
53585 	Apache h 	Document 	bugs@httpd.apache.org 	RESO 	FIXE 	Exact Directory match problem 	2012-07-23 

Shouldn't 52648 & 53585 also be included in the first list ? 
They are both marked as FIXED and if changed in the last 10 days, they have obviously also been changed in the last 60! 

Best regards

creator: christophe.jaillet@wanadoo.fr
text:
Apparently syntax for time based search has changed long ago in bugzilla.

For example: changedin=10
should be changed in: chfieldto=Now&chfieldfrom=-10D

'changedin' seems nowadays to mean :"exactly x days before"


I think that all shortcut to bugzilla given on http://httpd.apache.org/bug_report.html (and maybe elsewhere) should be double checked in order to put it inline with current syntax.

If needed, I can give help on that.
